result.execSummary:
The defendant Tawanda L. Staten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Conspiracy to Commit Unauthorized Use of an Entity's IdentifyING Information/documents. [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Conspiracy to Commit Fraudulent Claim/Income Tax Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 71.83(2)(b)4.
  • Theft-False Representation >$10,000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $202,520.00 payable to WI. Dept. of Revenue.  Joint and several with 15CF872 Sharon Staten and 15CF869 Angela Staten.  Bail to be applied.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: COUNTS ONE, TWO AND THREE to be served consecutively  to each other, and concurrent with sentence being served in Waukesha.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Copy of order dated 3/2/2021 mailed to the defendant.

DECISION AND ORDER
DENYING REQUEST FOR RECONSIDERATION

Per Order Dated February 11, 2021, Appeal No. 2021XX91-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Staten to file a notice of intent to pursue posdisposition relief from the cricuti court's January 8, 2021 order is extended to March 12, 2021.  This extension applies to a notice of intent to pursue postdispostion relief only from the January 8, 2021 order denying additional sentence credit: it does not encompass the original judgment of conviction in this matter. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within five days of the date of this order. the clerk of this court shall send to Staten a copy of the Rules of Appellate Procedure and a copy of the Guide to Appellate Procedure for the Self-Represented.  Staten is advised that those materials may arrrive separately from this order.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Glenn H. Yamahiro, Branch 34, for review. mag

IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Staten to file a notice of intent to pursue postdisposition relief from the circuit court's January 8, 2021 order is extended to March 12, 2021.  This extension applies o a notice of intent to pursue posdisposition relief only from the January 8, 2021 order denying additional sentence credit; it does not encompass the original judgment of conviction in this matter. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within five days of the date of this order, the clerk of this court shall send to Staten a copy of the Rules of appellate Procedure and a copy of the Guide to Appellate Procedure for the Self-Represented. Staten is advised that those materials may arrive separately from this order.

Original SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT Transcript (36 pages) commencing 04-19-2016 received and filed. CH
Substitution of counsel

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Order for substitution of counsel signed by the court.  Sentencing proceeded.  The court makes a finding of habituality as to all three counts that defendant pled to.  The court has reviewed all submissions by the state and defense.
Statements by the state, Dept of Revenue Agent Vern Barnes, defense and defendant.  Based upon the oral motion of the state, the court orders that attachment #2 of its sentencing packet be placed under SEAL.
AS to count 1:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 56 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS 
AS to count 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS 
AS to count 3:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 2.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS 
The court orders that counts 1,2,3 are to be served consecutively to each other and concurrent with sentence being served in Waukesha.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  The court orders restitution of $202,520.00 payable to WI DEPT OF REVENUE, joint/several with (15CF872) Sharon Staten and (15CF869) Angela Staten.  Court orders cash bail on deposit to be applied to restitution.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and is to be advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Filed:  CR-218; CR-234
Sentencing memorandum filed by defense
Filed:  Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys.  Proposed Order enclosed.
State's Sentencing Memorandum received and filed (unable to scan in courtroom due to attachments)

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in custody.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter had been set for jury trial today, however, parties have reached a resolution.
AS to counts 1 ,2, 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.
Court makes a finding of habituality as to counts 1 and 2.  
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Counts 4 through 28 are ordered dismisssed and read in for sentencing.
Case 16CF636 (COURT FILE NOT IN COURT) is also ordered dismissed:  count 1, Bail Jumping, dismissed and counts 2 and 3, Criminal Damage to Property, dismissmed and read in.  Preliminary hearing date is vacated.
Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 4-19-2016.
CR-218 filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Bench Warrant in file.  
Case is adjourned to 2-29-2016 for jury trial in Branch 38.
Defendant remanded.

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel requested final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 9/28/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Attorney Taylor has recently been appointed on this matter. Defense to attempt to retrieve discovery from prior counsel. Due to the voluminous discovery Court will allow one additional scheduling date. Case remains set for scheduling conference on 8/27/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered defendant to go to the Public Defender's Office to be re-Eformed immediately after court today.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel before Branch 25.  The 8/27/15 date was calendared with co-defendant and added to this case.  Public Defender's Office notified of upcoming court date.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed By Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt, Notice Of Motion & Motion To Withdraw

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the court he wished to withdraw as counsel, but did not file a motion.  Court ordered defense counsel to file a formal motion and set a motion  date.  Defendant's Justice Point reports gone over.  Court ADMONISHED defendant for current non-compliance and warned that failure to comply in the future would result in modification of the bail in this case.  Court continued bail as is and scheduled the matter before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (missed telephone contact 7-1-15), received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report (missed office visit), received and filed.

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date due to voluminous discovery.  State concurs.  Court granted defense request, but ordered case set for projected guilty plea.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Attorney Schoendfeldt just received file; requested another scheduling date to review same.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Tawanda L. Staten in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt also appeared in court. Attorney Ricci advised the Court that defendant has hired Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt and moved to withdraw.  Court allowed Attorney Ricci to withdraw and Attorney Schoenfeldt to substitute in.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
